intro: Dipcadi spirale, commonly known as the spiral buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
